title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ddelarosa@adatar.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries
title: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries
text: goal sfDR provide comprehensive suite simple feature (sf) objects administrative boundaries Dominican Republic, facilitating geospatial analysis mapping. sfDR designed used rgisDR package, provides functions working geographic data Dominican Republic R. can install rgisDR r-universe : can visit rgisDR website information.

title: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries
text: can install development version sfDR r-universe :

title: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries
text: basic example showing use sfDR plot Dominican Republic province map:  Suppose dataset showing percentage distribution remittances received province Dominican Republic specific year. visualize data using graph sfDR, first need combine remittance data province data. get desired graph, just apply plot function data.  Next, show achieve similar result using ggplot2. serves demonstrate create maps ways highlight simplicity process integrating everything one step.
code: library(sfDR)  DR_PROV_SF <- dr_provinces()  plot(DR_PROV_SF) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union   datos <- DR_PROV_SF |>   left_join(remittance_by_province, by = join_by('PROV_NAME' == 'province'))  datos %>%    sf::st_drop_geometry() %>%    head() #>   PROV_ID PROV_CODE              PROV_NAME  percentage #> 1      21        SC          San Cristóbal 0.010738704 #> 2      14       MTS María Trinidad Sánchez          NA #> 3      17       PER                Peravia 0.005948295 #> 4      20       SAM                 Samaná          NA #> 5      18        PP           Puerto Plata 0.018996422 #> 6      11        LA          La Altagracia          NA datos |>   select(percentage) %>%    plot() library(ggplot2) #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.3.1  dr_provinces() %>%   left_join(remittance_by_province, by = join_by('PROV_NAME' == 'province')) %>%    ggplot() +   geom_sf(aes(fill = percentage)) +   theme_void()

what: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
text: function loads Dominican Republic municipal districts simple features (sf) adds metadata municipalities, provinces, regions required. also optionally converts result sf object.

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
code: dr_municipal_districts(   .sf = TRUE,   .mun = FALSE,   .prov = FALSE,   .reg = FALSE,   .uniques = TRUE )

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
text: simple features collection 393 features 10 fields: MD_ID Municipal district number (6 digits) based División Territorial 2021 order MD_NAME Full name municipal district defined División Territorial 2021 MUN_ID Municipality number (4 digits) MUN_NAME Full name municipality PROV_ID Province number (2 digits) PROV_CODE Code province PROV_NAME Full name province REG_ID Region number REG_NAME Name region REG_CODE Code region geometry Polygon geometry representing municipal district

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
text: https://geoportal.iderd.gob./layers/geonode_data:geonode:RD_DM https://www.one.gob./publicaciones/2021/division-territorial-2021/

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
text: .sf Logical; TRUE, converts result sf object. Defaults TRUE. .mun Logical; FALSE, removes columns related municipalities. Defaults FALSE. .prov Logical; FALSE, removes columns related provinces. Defaults FALSE. .reg Logical; FALSE, removes columns related regions. Defaults FALSE. .uniques Logical; TRUE, removes duplicated IDs inserted consider territories names changes time. Defaults TRUE.

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
text: data frame sf object (.sf TRUE) loaded processed data.

title: Load Dominican Republic Municipal Districts Simple Features (sf)  — dr_municipal_districts
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load and process the data as sf object result <- dr_municipal_districts(TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE) print(result) } # }

what: Load Dominican Republic Sections Simple Features (sf)  — dr_sections
title: Load Dominican Republic Sections Simple Features (sf)  — dr_sections
text: function loads Dominican Republic sections simple features (sf) adds metadata municipal districts, municipalities, provinces, regions required. also optionally converts result sf object.

title: Load Dominican Republic Sections Simple Features (sf)  — dr_sections
code: dr_sections(   .sf = TRUE,   .dm = FALSE,   .mun = FALSE,   .prov = FALSE,   .reg = FALSE,   .uniques = TRUE )

title: Load Dominican Republic Sections Simple Features (sf)  — dr_sections
text: simple features collection 1,565 features 12 fields: SEC_ID Section number (8 digits) based División Territorial 2021 order SEC_NAME Full name section defined División Territorial 2021 MD_ID Municipal district number (6 digits) MD_NAME Full name municipal district MUN_ID Municipality number (4 digits) MUN_NAME Full name municipality PROV_ID Province number (2 digits) PROV_CODE Code province PROV_NAME Full name province REG_ID Region number REG_NAME Name region REG_CODE Code region geometry Polygon geometry representing section

what: sfDR: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries — sfDR-package
title: sfDR: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries — sfDR-package
text: sfDR package provides comprehensive collection simple feature (sf) objects administrative boundaries Dominican Republic, including provinces, municipalities, municipal districts, sections. datasets ideal geospatial analysis, mapping, data visualization, providing accurate --date information per `División Territorial 2021`.

title: sfDR: Simple Features for Dominican Republic Administrative Boundaries — sfDR-package
text: Maintainer: Daniel E. de la Rosa @dnldelarosa.com contributors: Adatar [copyright holder]
